title: Homes Destroyed As Central Coast Bushfire Forces Residents To Flee With Little Warning | 10 News
description: Dozens of homes have been destroyed by fire on the New South Wales Central Coast.   Residents forced to flee, with what little they could carry.  The fire is burning at Koolewong about an hour and a half north of Sydney.  It's a hilly area, known for its dense bushland. title: Woman’s Body Found In Parked Car Outside NSW  Police Station As Inquiry Begins | 10 News
description: The body of a woman has been found inside a parked car right outside a New South Wales police station.   A critical incident investigation is now underway, with police revealing she may have been dead for several days.  Phoebe Murray has the details. title: Netflix To Buy Warner Bros Studio In Multibillion-Dollar Deal Reshaping Hollywood | 10 News
description: A blockbuster shift is hitting Hollywood with Netflix set to buy the famed Warner Brothers Movie Studio in a takeover worth billions.  The move will unite the world’s biggest streaming service with the storied studio behind iconic hits such as Casablanca, Harry Potter, and Game of Thrones, in what experts are calling a new era in filmmaking.  But as our US Correspondent Katherine Firkin explains, there are concerns viewers could suffer. title: Dozens of Properties Lost As Extreme Heat And Wind Drive NSW Central Coast Fires | 10 News
description: Dozens of homes and properties have been destroyed after fast-moving bushfires swept through the NSW Central Coast.  Around 250 firefighters, supported by 50 trucks and nine aircraft, worked to contain the blazes yesterday as hot, windy conditions caused them to spread rapidly.  An emergency warning was issued for communities around Nimbin Road at Koolewong, advising residents they were in danger and to leave if the route toward Woy Woy remained open.  A second emergency warning was later declared for a fire at Milsons Gully in the Upper Hunter Region on Saturday afternoon, which expanded from 7,000 to more than 12,000 hectares in a single day.  The Koolewong blaze was one of more than 75 fires burning across NSW on Saturday. title: Koolewong Father Narrowly Escapes Fire In Home With 15-Month-Old Toddler In His Arms | 10 News+
description: A Koolewong dad has been left with burns to his feet after being forced to flee his fire-consumed home shoeless, carrying his 15-month-old child in his arms.  At least 16 homes have been lost as more than 300 firefighters continue to battle over 75 bushfires burning across NSW.  Despite a cool change in conditions today, Rural Fire Service Deputy Commissioner Ben Millington has warned, “we’re not out of the woods yet.”  Join the conversation and follow us on:  Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/10NewsPlus/  TikTok: https://www.tiktok.com/@10newsplus/  Snapchat: https://www.snapchat.com/add/tennewsplus   Spotify: https://open.spotify.com/show/0tWZ6sIJTQ2WHgYdjgaAA7?si=cb30d7fd3d3541fa    10 News+ airs at 6pm, from Sunday to Friday on Network 10. title: Residents Return To Bushfire Ruins As Up To 16 Homes Are Lost On The NSW Central Coast | 10 News
description: Residents at Koolewong on the New South Wales Central Coast have returned to the ruins of their homes, destroyed by a bushfire that forced them to run for their lives.   Authorities are still assessing the damage, but as many as 16 houses could've been lost.  State and Federal disaster funding has been activated, while firefighters continue to battle blazes across the State. title: NSW Beaches To Get More Shark Surveillance Drones Ahead Summer Season | 10 News
description: More drones than ever before will be monitoring beaches across New South Wales this Summer keeping an eye out for sharks.   The safety of every swimmer or surfer can't be guaranteed, and if the worst does happen, more shark-bite first aid kits will also be available at both city and regional beaches.

title: PM Defends Decision To Approve $94k On Three Flights To New Work Amid Spending Scrutiny | 10 News
description: The Communications Minister has been forced to explain business class flights, lavish meals, and a family snow trip - all on the taxpayer's dime.   Accused of being out of touch, Anika Wells insists the work trips are all within parliamentary rules and she has the PM's backing. title: Trump Awards Kennedy Centre Medals & Takes Swipe At Presenter Jimmy Kimmel During Ceremony | 10 News
description: Donald Trump has handed out honours to some of the biggest veterans of show business.  Sylvester Stallone, Gloria Gaynor and rock band KISS were all awarded Kennedy Centre medals, recognising their lifetime contributions to the performing arts.   Donald Trump hosted this year's awards and couldn't help taking a swipe at one of the country's most popular presenters. title: Former Top Gun Pilot Held In Maximum Security Jail, While Wife Left To Raise 6 Kids Alone | 10 News+
description: Daniel Duggan has been locked up in a maximum-security jail without any Australian charges - for almost three years. His wife, Saffrine, is raising their six children alone.   Before he launched his Top Gun flying school in Australia, American prosecutors claim Dan Duggan was part of a years-long conspiracy to illegally train Chinese military pilots in South Africa during which he laundered the money he earned.   Saffrine claims her husband is an innocent pawn in a geopolitical game between the US and China. title: Parents Warned Against E-Bike Purchases For Kids Ahead Of Christmas | 10 News+
description: Health officials are urging parents to proceed with caution this Christmas, when considering e-bike and e-scooter purchases for their children, given e-Bike related trauma in hospitals across the country rise each year.   NSW Ambulance records show e-bike related injuries have almost doubled year-on-year from 580 patients in 2024 to 1,100 so far in 2025.
